awd_titl_txt: Travel: Student Travel Support for the International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) 2024
awd_abstract_narration:
This proposal seeks a travel grant to enable students in US universities to participate in the IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE 2024), which will be held in Utrecht, Netherlands, May 13-16, 2024. The grant will be used exclusively for students in US-based institutions, and it will enable the supported students to travel to Utrecht, Netherlands to participate in the conference and its associated workshops. The funding will defray the registration, travel, and lodging costs for the students. 

It will enable a life-enriching first-time experience for many students, giving them a taste of the research environment in both academic and industrial circles worldwide. ICDE is a premier conference in the area of databases, and participation in this conference will enable the students to enhance their scientific foundation and build their professional networks.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

por.por_cntn:
The IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) is a premier database research conference. It is one of the go-to forums for sharing research results in the database area and is an important venue for professional networking and enabling new research innovations. The 2024 conference was the 40th ICDE, and it was held in Utrecht, Netherlands, from May 13-16, 2024. The goal of this project was to provide travel grants to PhD students in US universities to support their participation in ICDE. Participation in a major conference like ICDE is an important training activity for PhD students. It exposes them to state-of-the-art research and allows them to grow their professional network. For students who are authors of presented papers, attending the conference gives them a chance to present their work. As such, this project served an important educational and training purpose for the students who were funded by the travel awards.

The PI, Dr. Ashraf Aboulnaga, was a co-chair of the Industry and Applications Program Committee at ICDE 2024. The co-PI, Dr. Gautam Das, was a co-chair of the Research Program Committee. A four-member committee was formed to select the PhD students who would receive the travel award. The committee consisted of Dr. Aboulnaga and Dr. Das as co-chairs and had Dr. Abolfazl Asudeh (University of Illinois at Chicago) and Dr. Amr Magdy (University of California, Riverside) as members.

The award was advertised on the conference website (https://icde2024.github.io/studentAwards.html) and on the popular DBWorld mailing list for database research. A total of 27 applications were received, out of which 17 PhD students received a travel award. The committee prioritized students who were co-authors of papers at the conference and those with multiple years of database research experience.

The 17 PhD students who received the travel award attended ICDE. They also volunteered at the conference, which helped the conference and gave the students opportunities for richer and deeper networking with the conference organizers and attendees.

The ICDE 2024 conference had 782 attendees from 38 countries. The top five countries were China (335 attendees), USA (79 attendees), Netherlands (53 attendees), Germany (52 attendees), and Hong Kong (47 attendees). Attending a major conference like ICDE is an important milestone for PhD students, so this grant provided the students with a valuable training and professional development opportunity.

 

 

 


Last Modified: 11/30/2024
Modified by: Ashraf Aboulnaga
